item.title: Extra Stuff
item.description:
The back of house is crazy but simple to be focused

The past few weeks I’ve been doing the truck, learning porter, grill, sandwiches and office work. Also taking temps and doing other assorted paperwork needed to run the restaurant daily, and freezer pulls. Doing truck is hard some days because youre in a -10deg freezer.

things to do

131 principle. one problem, three solutions, one recommendation. 80/20 rule for standup, staff talk for 80 of the time management speaks 20. curiosity, systems and goals, measurement. So I think I’m going to implement standups, 4 mins. Ask about the previous service, ask about today and problems and solutions and focus. Ask about things they did wrong and what they should do to avoid that, talk about accountability. See if this has an impact over the next week and if it does then bring it up for everyone(managers) to implement. Invite them in for it.

item.title: Staying late
item.description:
People come and people go

I feel like theres been a few people that have been let go and a few that have quit. I think one person walked out this evening. Its not a bad job, its really fun. I think the manager staff is a little new at the game though. Its their first time being in charge and they have an idea of how they want to manage but dont know how to do it. Most likely, none of them have ever had a good boss before, so they dont know what that feels like and dont have an idea of how to get there. Sometimes I give little pep talks to them, but I’m not sure if that helps. I’m in an odd position, im just a worker, nobody bothers me, nothing bothers me, I do whats expected and fill my time with useful tasks, seek out new tasks and information and ways to help, and do that. I know I’m probably older than all the managers and I suppose that gets me some respect? I’m not sure how I fit into the picture, I train people on stations, I try to be a good role model. This isn’t hard, especially since I’ve used the past year to straighten a lot of my life out by going to meetings and working on myself.

item.title: Eight Hours
item.description:
Its a lot of work

But I feel so satisfied. Working my body like this is really a cure all for me. For the past week and some change my hours have been around 6-7 a day and today I think was the first time I did more than 8. 10 total. I’ve been watching the national team and managers do 12 hour days for the past couple weeks and see how its taken a toll on them. I think I’m capable of doing those hard weeks, back to back, trying to get everyone up to speed. It sounds like fun to me. Right now I’m learning a position called Set, Its like the expo for the front of the house and its a lot of work. A lot more compared to the drive thru or register. Drive thru is like a little separate heaven where the madness doesn’t touch. Sometimes you’ll get weirdos at the window but thats not that bad. The management staff is a bit wild. Theres some good bosses and some anxious ones and some that are probably just plain bad. I wonder what Andrew thinks about how things are going so far. I wish there was time to sit and talk with him but I dont think there is. Culver’s life is busy. Maybe one day he’ll get someone to GM the place for him and then he’ll have time for other things, but from what I’ve seen of him so far I think he’s a good boss.

item.title: Training
item.description:
I feel good

I’m surprised that things feel good. Work has been very good, lots of physical work but satisfying. Its so chaotic in the restaurant, everyone is learning and trying to figure out the proper processes for everything. Its a mad house and I love it. I do need to find a programming job though. I’ll want to keep doing this for the awesome food and custard and everything fulfilling this job gives me, but I think realistically, I need that programmer money first. Maybe down the line I can give owning a Culver’s a go, the pay for that is pretty good (300K-400K/yr) and its really a great company. People I’ve met from the support or national team were excellent people, and one girl Hailey was outstanding. Patient teacher, had all the good manager qualities, and also very attractive. She’s just become an owner at a store in Iowa someplace.

item.title: Johnny Terilli
item.description:
Johnny Terilli is sad

Some people can’t accept things as they are. They need a reason. Their inability to go through life without being able to tell themselves “I’m the best” is one of the glamorous causes of their problems. Lying to yourself, is an easy sport. And its simple to win and convince yourself that your problems are so much worse than anyone else’s. You are a great hero, a paragon, a martyr. Any input that says otherwise is due to a problem that someone else is going through. Its not honest, its them working through their problems. The levels of manipulation and trickery these people will employ on others and themselves to protect their precious story is one of the more depressive patterns in the world. If only you would dogfood the things you were trying to say. You’d probably be better. But you don’t and you’re too old to change.

item.title: Workweek
item.description:
What was the problem?

Where was my drive to do anything? It was gone for about a year and now in a week its fallen into an appropriate position. The only change was picking up a fast food job, which at first felt like a failure. But now it feels great, amazing even. I can’t remember a time when I didn’t care about my job at all in this way. Not the way of “I dont care about it so I won’t try to achieve”, but I don’t have any fear about the work, the people, any interaction. Any anxieties have been replaced with a soaring confidence. The work is not difficult. I’ve managed to find a way to have fun in the monotony and improve on parts of myself that I’d been neglecting. The job feels like a project. A side quest. Something for the thrill of the experience. Which is a pretty good way to frame it. It would be so easy to judge myself as a failure and the fast food job as proof. But I’ve done that a thousand times already. The past year of living in the void was enough time to beat myself to death and then try not to. I’ll start with a slackbot to help people reschedule shifts. And then if they like that, maybe theres other little things I can do to make the place better. Its so weird. I used to have a bit of pride that I didn’t work a fast food job. That didn’t help much of anything though.

item.title: Cat Feelings
item.description:
Not having a job

My cat is big. Not really fat, just big. Big boned I suppose and about twenty pounds. A buff, which is another term for light orange, American short-hair. The other week I spent a couple of days cat sitting for my friend and I got to spend a lot of quality time with their cat. Her name was Surreal. She was a sweet, cuddly indoor/outdoor cat who knew that I was her friend and a welcome source of petting, playing, love and affection. It was great. As far as cat software goes she had some A+ cat code installed. Its always funny when I spend time around other cats, then come home to my cat and remember how much of a monster she is compared to regular cats. Not quite Maine Coon, but still, quite enough. Nala, my cat, is skittish, a big scaredy. She doesn’t trust anyone except me, which makes me feel special and its sort of endearing, but I wish she would be more confident. This is a criticism I’ve heard made about me in recent years and, yeah, I wish so too. I can remember the overflowing confidence of my 20s and I just don’t feel that way anymore. Sure I can fake it, but being honest is so much easier. I dont want to trick people into liking a ‘for show’ version of myself. Did I teach my cat my un-confidence? That cant be possible, could it? I don’t think so. I remember taking her to the vet during covid and one trip changed her attitude forever. She WAS a confident and fearless kitten. Curious and wild, but after the one trip to the vet she was so afraid. I used to be able to touch her hands and cut her nails and now cutting her nails is impossible. During covid you had to drop your animal outisde the door of the vet and then come back an hourish later to pick them up. I feel like if I was able to go inside and be with her in the vet this wouldnt have happened. As a scared cat I still love her, but I wish she would demand pets, I wish I could carry her and that awkward sounds wouldnt set her off. I’ve done a lot to try to un-shy her. Maybe she needs a little friend, a brother or a sister to show her the ways of wild cat youth. To inspire her to relax and open up.

item.title: Lying Expectations
item.description:
Lying for good

I’ve been mulling ideas about lying over for a couple days. Telling the truth is the easiest way forward, generally, but there are edge cases. Like the Japanese grandmother where her family knew she had fatal cancer and lied to her. They let her think she was healthy, so she wouldn’t get sad and depressed and could live out her days without worrying about the things that come with a stage 4 diagnosis. I think she ended up living a couple years longer than was expected. Is this a good lie? For her, maybe. If I was her family, I would have felt conflicted. I’ve been lied and been lied to plenty of times through omission and being on either side doesn’t feel good. The spirit of the grandmother lie is good but the follow through still results in bad feelings for family like me. That’s expected, death is rough in any situation but I’m not really convinced its good. There’s a certain type of person and situation where it is the best, most moral action but that situation probably wouldn’t involve me. Lying for a good reason, and getting a good result - thats good. Lying for a bad reason and getting a bad result - I suppose thats good in terms of expectations but the morality isn’t. The other variations good reason bad result/bad reason good result, are big problems. This isnt really going anywhere. Life has gotten a lot simpler. A whole category of problems has been removed after choosing to be honest at all times, even if you might hurt someone’s feelings.

item.title: Working Plan
item.description:
I think this is the thing to do

I haven’t had a job for over a year and I think Culver’s just hired me. This is going to be an interesting ride. I remember feeling a kind of pride for not having worked a fast food job in the past. Is this a success? It doesn’t feel like it. This is going to be a wide cast of characters, kids in high school, 60 year olds, lots of attitudes and hungry grumps. Good thing I have access to emotions like anger and frustration again. Typically, I’m a very patient person and this doesn’t feel like it will be a problem, but I don’t know everything, and I’ve been wrong before. Having something to do while getting my programming chops back is a benefit and I suppose that is a victory. The past year has been a lot of emotions and stagnation. An inability to move anything. This is movement. That’s good. It’s something.

item.title: Sanity is not statistical
item.description:
There is a lot of feelings

After a huge failure last year of breaking down, going to rehab, quitting a great job, navigating an impossible family relationship, where do I find the motivation to do anything? Laying down and giving up is such an inviting idea. I’ve been trying to avoid using anger and frustration as a motivator. Could I move through the world on positive emotions? I can’t, at least not right now. Most of my will is dedicated to trying not to go down negative mental rabbit holes that lead to me doing nothing. If I can fight off the bad feelings then I can move - this way doesnt really work. When everything feels so negative its impossible to think myself out of it. One thing Ive learned is that the opposite is true. A simple “fake it till you make it” attitude. Just act like you’re happy, do the things a happy person would do and then your thinking will follow you there over time. This is a weird point in time right now. I’ve just gotten off anti-depressants and the access to more emotions has come back. Feelings like anger and frustration have replaced a detatched, zombie-like ambivalence. As my brain levels back out, the emotions yo-yo just like when I first got on them. Using negative feelings as motivation felt like a failure a couple weeks ago, but now what else am I supposed to do with it?

item.title: I can't think myself into good acting but I can act myself into good thinking.
item.description:
Betrayal and character assassination

Why do people punish themselves? Pride. Sometimes in weird places, sometimes in obvious ones. Write from the scar, not from the wound. Itll be too emotional if its from an open wound. Thats pretty good advice. Getting away for a few days is great to reflect and figure out what I’m doing with myself. Its been a lot of nothing, starving, depression. Not good. Having someone to yell at you and rile you up is a strange bonus. I can use any negative feelings as fuel to get things done, but I’ve been trying to avoid that for a while. Can’t I find enough positive emotions to use as a motivation source? It doesnt look like it, at least not right now. It was a decent experiment.

item.title: It's a beautiful thing, the destruction of words
item.description:
Not convincing enough

Trying to convince someone not to lie is a rough game. Especially if the lies are to themselves. The amount of depression and gaslighting that’s come out of me trying to get my mother to be honest has been a challenge. It can’t be done. Changing other people, if they don’t want to, is impossible, and if its not then its probably through some illegal means. I suppose I need to be more selfish. Not think about this. Just be a good person and not try to control anyone else, even if I’m right, or trying to help or whatever reason I can come up with. Patience, honesty, serenity feel like easy goals until something pops up. There’s always some event or topic or trigger where that goes out the window. If I ate better I would be better, stress will take my appetite away and the lack of food will fuel my anxiety.

item.title: Who controls the past.
item.description:
I have too many expectations of my mom

Shes getting old and her judgement is beginning to go. The other month she was sure she’d been texting Elon Musk and he was waiting on her gift cards so he could finish delivering a Tesla and 100K to her. Part of me is fighting with her, trying to reason things out with her to show her how to watch out for traps like this. Another part is fighting reality, I don’t want to admit that her thinking is so compromised. That its just going to get harder for her to understand me. She’s doing it too, she’s fighting the fact she’s going to die, that her thinking has gotten worse, constantly telling herself she’s not as bad as someone else in the Assisted Living Facility. It must be terrible to be in your 70s and be afraid of death and aging. Knowing that your father and sister suffered from dementia and that you are next in line. If I don’t think about it then its not happening. I wish that were the case. I wish I could do something to remove her insecurities, find her some friends, stop her from judging herself and others. She’s been alone too long and her pride is being used to keep her ego afloat. I can just try to show her I love her, even though she won’t understand it.
